column12: Description

Christina was shot.

Christina was a Hurricane Katrina evacuee from New Orleans. The Houston Chronicle first misgendered Christina as "he" and "him".

http://tgdor.org/list.shtml

Kaaseem's body was found near a rest stop on Interstate 29 outside of Glenwood, Iowa. There was initially some suspicion that her death was a suicide, but additional details have caused police to suspect a homicide.

She was a 60 year old post-operative trans woman who had been living in Kansas City, Kansas.

 http://tgdor.org/list.shtml

The victim’s body was discovered head-first in a garbage bin, wearing a dark T-shirt, white shorts and padded bra.

Police revealed that there was a single slash wound on the neck and numerous bruises on her body.

Her identity remains unknown, but was likely of Chinese of East Malaysian descent, but living within the local area.

http://tgdor.org/list.shtml

Donathyn was shot multiple times while working near Max Hayes High in the early morning of 15th November. When she ran, she was shot several more times.

She had participated in events at the Lesbian-Gay Community Service Center of Greater Cleveland. 

http://tgdor.org/list.shtml
Rani was stoned to death.

Vanessa stopped breathing during a melee with sheriff's deputies. She died after four days on life support.

She had been taken into police custody after being found naked and bleeding profusely, after smashing through a plate glass window in an attempted burglary at a neighbour's home.

She became enraged while en route to hospital, and again later in the intake area to the jail - possibly because the police were treating her as male. When the police attempted to subdue her, she suffered severe injuries which led to her death.

https://queerhistory.blogspot.com/2011/11/

https://malikatv.blogspot.com/2006/

http://tgdor.org/list.shtml

The victim was repeatedly beaten and hacked with a garden hoe by John Freeman. Freeman did not know his victim.

All that is know about them is that they died while wearing women's clothing.

http://tgdor.org/list.shtml
Simone was shot multiple times.
Roberta was deliberately struck by a vehicle. She was a twenty eight year old Brazilian transgender woman living in Italy.

Paulina was shot twice in the head.

She was in Guatemala city with another trans woman when four men wearing police uniforms and riding motorbikes ordered them to stop and then shot both of them. Paulina was shot twice in the head, and died minutes later. Sulma, the other victim, survived three gunshot wounds.

Paulina worked for Integral Sexuality AIDS Support Organisation (OASIS).

http://tgdor.org/list.shtml

Alexis was shot.

The Associated Press reported her death with the transphobic headline:  "Hooker Who Is Man, Killed".

http://tgdor.org/list.shtml

Tiffany was shot 3 times.

http://tgdor.org/list.shtml

Yardena was shot.

http://tgdor.org/list.shtml

Gisberta was tortured by a group of 14 teenagers from St. Jos Center ("a strict Catholic school for boys"). She ultimately died by drowning after they threw her into a pit of water.

> "According to the case, they told the others that they knew a "man" with "tits" and that "he looked like a woman". That's how 14 boys got together, eager to meet the transsexual, and the abandoned building became a rendezvous point - and some of the teenagers started attacking Gisberta.
> 
> As of February 15, 2006, they began to group together to commit multiple acts of violence against women who were beaten, raped and humiliated over three days, with stones, beatings - the pieces of wood were also used to rape her - and cigarette burns.
> 
> Between 21 and 22 of the same month, the young people returned to the place and found the Brazilian unconscious. Believing she was dead, they thought of ways to disappear with her body and threw her into the pit of the building, filled with water. She was unconscious, but alive, and died drowned.
> 
> One of the students confessed the crime to a teacher and the body was discovered the same day. The case quickly made the news, which treated Gisberta in the male and extremely derogatory way.

Gisberta was a Brazilian immigrant who lived in Porto. A transgender, homeless woman, living illegally in Europe, she had left Brazil for France at the age of 18 to escape a wave of murders in Sao Paulo that victimized trans people.

Of her attackers, only one was over 16 years old and could be criminally punished, Vitor Santos (who according to his colleagues, did not attack the victim, only observed the others) was sentenced to 8 months imprisonment for the crime of omission of aid. The others were sentenced to 13 months in the Educational Center; by September 2007 all were already free.

Frustration with the outcome of the trial led to an intense mobilisation by activists who adopted Gisberta as a symbol of transphobia ande won protective laws for trans people in Portugal. For example, since 2011, it has been possible for trans people to rectify their documents without the need for surgeries.

Gisberta's story later became a play, a documentary and the song Balada de Gisberta, composed by the Portuguese Pedro Abrunhosa and played by Maria Bethânia.

column6: tdor.info/3-21-2006/Melissa Green ( known to friends as Mo)
column12:
Melissa was shot.

http://tgdor.org/list.shtml

Rupesh was a thirteen year old transgender girl living in the Mahotari district of Nepal. She was suffocated by her father, Tapeshore Mandal.

Her mother found her body. The father claimed that she had poisoned herself, but a most-mortem indicated that she died of suffocation, not poisoning.

Mandal had banished her after discovering that she was going to meetings of the Blue Diamond Society (BDS), the only organisation in Nepal for sexual minorities. While she rejoined the family after promising to stop going to the BDS, her father continued to abuse and neglect her, and said that he would kill her unless she stopped presenting herself as female.
Robert was hit twice on the back of the head with a flashlight.

Ariana was beaten unconscious and found hidden in the bushes of a the quiet San Francisco Stockton neighborhood. They died as a result of being beaten around the head. 

News reports reported that they had both a male ("Alfred") and female ("Ariana") identity, and that their family were aware of this. Their gender identity is unknown, but it should be noted that it is not unknown for trans women to live in this way for years prior to formal transition.

> Murder victim Alfred Dibble lived two lives.
>
> To his family, the Stockton man was an inspiring 33-year-old who worked at a liquor store to pay his way through college and become a registered nurse. But at night, he transformed himself, putting on makeup and women’s clothes.
> 
> On Friday, his family held his funeral, less than a week after Dibble, while dressed as a woman, was beaten in downtown Stockton and thrown into the bushes to die. They believe he was the victim of a hate crime, singled out for his alternative lifestyle.
> 
> Rivera said his family knew he was gay and liked to dress like a woman, but they didn’t talk about it. His climb from a clerk at March’s Liquor Mart to the medical profession impressed the family, Rivera said.

https://www.recordnet.com/article/20060527/NEWS01/605270343

https://happening-here.blogspot.com/2007/03/goodbye-dear-ruby.html

http://tgdor.org/list.shtml

Sudha suffered multiple stab wounds to the genitals.

http://tgdor.org/list.shtml

Barbara was killed in a drive-by shooting. She was believed to be from Honduras.

http://tgdor.org/list.shtml

Lupita  was stabbed 5 times by a client.

When captured by police, Engjell Ndreca initially claimed Lupita was his "boyfriend” and that she was HIV-positive, but several contradictions have appeared within his story.

Lupita was a Colombian working as a sex worker in Italy.

Lezlie was initially believed by police to have died by suicide in the apartment she shared with a Thai friend. However the suicide note left behind appeared to be a forgery and was not written by her.

Lezlie was an American citizen who was living and working in Thailand.

Mikey was beaten to death by his father, Alex Mendoza, who had repeatedly called him a "sissy”.

Mendoza also often slapped his son in an effort to "toughen him up,” and urged him to beat up an Elmo doll. Mikey Vallejo-Seiber died in a local hospital from internal injuries sustained from being kicked, punched, and dropped on his head while in Mendoza’s care.

Mikey's mother Pamela Seiber, pleaded guilty to child endangerment and was sentences to six years in prison. Mendoza entered a plea of not guilty.

Editors note: Although we will obviously never know whether Mikey may eventually have identified as trans, it is fitting that he be remembered here.

https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/59088475/micheal-a.-vallejo-seiber

https://www.facebook.com/232790533557867/photos/rot-in-hell-you-evil-monster-mikey-was-kicked-beaten-stomped-burned-sodomized-an/232944810209106/
